content: If a student is missing class a bunch, their grade is going to be effected regardless, so as teachers we might as well give them grace. K-12 students get sick, and may be reliant on parents or siblings to get them to school, and attendance policies hurt underprivileged kids.

Some reasons a certain portion of kids are thriving during remote learning:

1. Freedom to be self-directed learners
2. More comfortable communicating with peers/teachers through chat bars and emails
3. Unrestricted access to digital content

All 3 can still happen in-person!
